tool.name: Chimera.perseus
tool.command:
echo 'chimera.perseus( fasta=$fasta, #if $name.is_of_type("mothur.names"): name=$name, #elif $name.is_of_type("mothur.count_table"): count=$name, #end if #if $group: group=$group, #end if alpha=$alpha, beta=$beta, cutoff=$cutoff, dereplicate=$dereplicate, processors='\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-8}' )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur &&
## move output files to correct destination prefix="$fasta" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.perseus.chimeras "$out_chimeras" && mv mothur.*.logfile "$logfile"; ## accnos file is only created if chimeras were found in sample ##if [ -f \${prefix%.dat}.perseus.accnos ]; ##then ## mv \${prefix%.dat}*.perseus.accnos "$out_accnos"; ##fi

param.name: dereplicate
param.label: dereplicate - remove chimeric sequences from all groups, default=f
param.help: If parameter is false, then if one group finds the seqeunce to be chimeric, then all groups find it to be chimeric

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The chimera.perseus_ command reads a fasta and name file, and outputs potentially chimeric sequences.
.. _chimera.perseus: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Chimera.perseus
